result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy G Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Billy G Brooks in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed - reading waived.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct.  1 :
- 203 days jail - credit for 203 days. Court orders time served. 
- Court costs in the amount of $243.00 - defendant given credit for 5 days - Court costs paid in full.
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 - defendant given credit for 4 days - DNA Surcharge paid in full.
- Restitution of $152.67 to be paid to US Bank - Court enter civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Billy G Brooks in court, in custody, with attorney Amy C Scholz.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
Arraignment on December 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Billy G Brooks in court, in custody, with attorney Amy C Scholz.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Witnesses are sequestered for hearing. Officer Bradley Meyer, Town of Broofield Police Department, sworn and testified. Detective Sean Schmidt, Town of Brookfield Police Department, sworn and testified. Officer Sandra Brown, Village of Elm Grove Police Department, sworn and testified. Detective Craig Mayer, Elm Grove Police Department, sworn and testified. State moves for bindover and presents argument to the court. Attorney Scholz moves for dismissal of all counts.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. State may add party to a crime to burglary charge and requests one week to file Information. Attorney Scholz files Speedy Trial Demand and Substitution of Judge request. Court hears defense bail motion. Attorney Scholz presents bail argument. State objects to modification of bail. Court denies motion to modify bail for reasons stated on the record.  Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.
